meanings.definition: To mock or taunt someone in a rude or sarcastic manner.
meanings.sent1: The kids were jeering at the new student during recess.
meanings.sent2: The bullies were jeering at the smaller boy in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent3: The jeering from the crowd made the comedian's jokes even funnier.
meanings.sent4: Her jeering laughter echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The jeering voices of the fans filled the stadium with negativity.

meanings.definition: The act of mocking or taunting someone in a rude or sarcastic manner.
meanings.sent1: The jeering of the audience made the speaker feel small.
meanings.sent2: The jeering at the comedy show was loud and disruptive.
meanings.sent3: The jeering from the siblings turned into a playful banter.
meanings.sent4: The jeering in the movie theater added to the suspense of the film.
meanings.sent5: The jeering at the talent show was met with disapproving glares.
